verses.verse: I wish you would allow me a little foolishness; please bear with me.
For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy, for I have betrothed you to one husband, so that I can present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
I fear lest in some way, like the serpent deceived Eve, through his trickery, so your minds might be corrupted away from the single-heartedness to Christ.

For if another comes preaching another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or different gospel which you have not accepted, you might well enough put up with him.
I consider myself to not be inferior in any way to these very super "apostles."
For though I may be unrefined in speaking, but I am not in knowledge. We have made this very clear to you in everything.
Have I committed some offense by abasing myself, so you could be exalted, just because I have preached the Gospel of God freely to you?
I robbed other congregations, taking wages from them to minister to you.

When I was with you and in need, I was not burdensome to any one, for what was lacking, the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied. In every thing I have kept my self from being a burden to you, and so I will continue to keep myself.
As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Why? Because I don't love you? God knows.
But what I do, that I will do, so that I may cut off any opportunity from those who are looking for an opportunity, so that they can go on bragging, so they could be thought of as we are.
For so fake apostles [are], deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.
And no wonder, for even Satan disguises himself into an angel of light.
Therefore it is not surprising if his servants are disguised as servants of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.
Let me repeat Let no one take me as a fool; and if otherwise, still receive me as a fool, so that I can boast a little.
What I'm talking about now, I'm not talking by the Lord; instead as if foolishly, in this confident boasting.
Since many brag after the flesh, I will boast a little too.
For you gladly put up with fools, since you are so wise.
For you put up with a man if he enslaves you, eats you alive, takes from you, exalts himself, or slugs you on the face.
I am ashamed to admit that we were too weak, but in what someone is bold (I am speaking foolishly), I am bold, too.
Are they Hebrews? Me too. Are they Israelites? Me too. Are they descendants of Abraham? Me too.

Are they servants of Christ? (I am talking like a fool); I am even more in hard work--greater; receiving stripes [from whippings]--excessively; in imprisonments--more frequently; even more frequently near death.
Five times I received from the Jews forty stripes minus one.
Three times I was beaten with clubs; once I was stoned. Three times I suffered shipwreck; I spent a day and night in the deep.
[Also I have had] more frequents trips, dangers in water, from robbers, from my own countrymen, from the heathen, in the city, in the wilderness, in the sea, and from fake brethren.
in physical fatigue, in pain, deprived of sleep, hungry, thirsty, frequent fasting, cold and lacking clothes.
Beside all those outward things, I have the daily heavy burden of worrying about the congregations.
Does someone feel weak, and I don't feel weak [with them]? Does someone cause another to stumble, and I don't burn [with anger].
If I have to boast, I will boast about my weaknesses.
The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
In Damascus, the governor under Aretas, the king, was keeping a constant watch around the city of Damascus so he could seize me.
I was let down in a basket through a window by the wall and escaped his hands.
